An interview with BIRI faculty member Dr. @AGChristodoulou:

"I think MRI is the most beautiful medical invention of all time, but unfortunately, imaging remains really difficult for cardiac patients." https://t.co/S5F11N5ec7 https://t.co/RXYe93urrr

"Coronary plaque is often not measured because there is not a fully automated way to do it," said BIRI faculty member @damini_dey.

"When it is measured, it takes an expert at least 25 to 30 min, but now we can use this program to quantify plaque from CTA images in 5 to 6 sec" https://t.co/N79owlg42P
